Articles.Content:
UKS pod on Verbljud booster

Abort fires the launch escape rockets

The launch escape rockets also acts as deorbit rockets, then fired four at a time, for a total delta-v of 150 m/s. The crew module also has independent RCS.

Action-10 deployes parachutes, which is useful both in case of abort and if you haven't fired all retrorockets when you are landing.

First (boosters) and second (core) stages can place you in low orbit.

Second stage will deorbit itself when staging.

After that, UKS module has about 400 m/s.

Download: https://docs.google.com/file/d/0Bz81WxkFXuN7Rk02cGtKa2xndzQ/edit?usp=sharing

Stork 2 on Verbljud booster

If you need to abort, after the Separatrons have burned out, use Action-09 to separate the crew pod and Action-10 to deploy the parachutes.

The LES will go away with the first staging event, but if you want to get rid of it earlier use Action-01.

Action-02 extends the antennas and solar panels.

Action-03 toggles solar panels.

Download: https://docs.google.com/file/d/0Bz81WxkFXuN7V0EtTEl2Z3U0eE0/edit?usp=sharing

KBE pods on Caribou boosters

Download:

Liquid fuel boosters: https://docs.google.com/file/d/0Bz81WxkFXuN7b25mUVBHbWpXNVk/edit?usp=sharing

Solid fuel boosters: https://docs.google.com/file/d/0Bz81WxkFXuN7VEkwZlp4VUNONGc/edit?usp=sharing

Action-02 extends solar panels

Action-03 toggles solar panels

Action-09 separates pod

Action-10 deploys parachutes

Action-RCS retracts solar panels

UKS looks like a TKS and Stork 2 looks like a soyuz

Nice work though

UKS = TKS: Yes, indeed.

The Stork evolved directly from this and was more like a manned HTV in concept:
these are cool lookin' rockets. good job!
